blendRequired.name: blendRequired
blendRequired.description: Whether or not this filter requires the previous render texture for blending.

clipToViewport.name: clipToViewport
clipToViewport.description: Clip texture into viewport or not

compatibleRenderers.name: compatibleRenderers
compatibleRenderers.description:
A number that uses two bits on whether the shader is compatible with the WebGL renderer and/or the WebGPU renderer.
0b00 - not compatible with either
0b01 - compatible with WebGL
0b10 - compatible with WebGPU
This is automatically set based on if a GlProgram or GpuProgram is provided.

enabled.name: enabled
enabled.description: If enabled is true the filter is applied, if false it will not.

glProgram.name: glProgram
glProgram.description: An instance of the GL program used by the WebGL renderer

gpuProgram.name: gpuProgram
gpuProgram.description: An instance of the GPU program used by the WebGPU renderer

padding.name: padding
padding.description:
The padding of the filter. Some filters require extra space to breath such as a blur.
Increasing this will add extra width and height to the bounds of the object that the
filter is applied to.

resolution.name: resolution
resolution.description:
The resolution of the filter. Setting this to be lower will lower the quality but
increase the performance of the filter.

resources.name: resources
resources.description: A record of the resources used by the shader.

uid.name: uid
uid.description: A unique identifier for the shader

edgeBlur.name: edgeBlur
edgeBlur.description:
How much more should the edge/corner of the screen blur? This reproduces CRT screens which would be
well focussed in the middle and slightly unfocused in the corners

scanlines.name: scanlines

multisampling.name: multisampling
multisampling.description:
Enable multisampling (FSAA) for smoother curvature, but also slower rendering.
Also add some blurring.

maskBrightness.name: maskBrightness
maskBrightness.description:
Brightness of the mask pattern (0-1). This is the brightness of the 'off' pixels - a value of 1
turns the phosphor mask effect off entirely. A value of 0 means only pure red, green, and blue
pixels will be on

numSamples.name: numSamples
numSamples.description:
Number of samples for antialiasing (1 = off, 2-8 recommended). Setting this higher can
avoid Moire patterns, but is slower to render. Try adjusting in combination with the transition
width to get a good compromise.

transitionWidth.name: transitionWidth
transitionWidth.description:
how smooth is the transition between R,G,B phosphors.
0 = hard edge, 1 = very smooth

A hard edge (0) is more authentic, but can produce moire patterns,
especially with small pixelWidth and a low number of samples.

gapBrightness.name: gapBrightness
gapBrightness.description:
Brightness of the gap between scanlines (0-1). Setting this to 1 turns scanlines off entirely.
Setting to 0 makes hard, dark scanlines.

pixelHeight.name: pixelHeight
pixelHeight.description: Height of each scanline in pixels
